name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: [SOUND] In

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: this lecture we give an overview of Text Mining and Analytics.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _First
column6: let's define the term text mining

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: The title of this course is called Text Mining and Analytics.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _But the two terms text mining
column6: and text analytics are actually roughly the same. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _So we are not really going to really distinguish them
column6: and _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: we're going to use them interchangeably.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: But the reason that we have chosen to use

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _both terms in the title is because there is also some subtle difference

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: if you look at the two phrases literally.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: Mining emphasizes more on the process.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: So it gives us a error rate medical view of the problem.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _Analytics
column6: on the other hand emphasizes more on the result

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: or having a problem in mind.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: We are going to look at text data to help us solve a problem.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _But again as I said
column6: we can treat these two terms roughly the same. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: And I think in the literature you probably will find the same.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: So we're not going to really distinguish that in the course.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: Both text mining and text analytics mean that we

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _want to turn text data into high quality information
column6: or actionable knowledge. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _So in both cases
column6: we _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: have the problem of dealing with a lot of text data and we hope to.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: Turn these text data into something more useful to us than the raw text data.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: And here we distinguish two different results.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _One is high-quality information
column6: the other is actionable knowledge. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: Sometimes the boundary between the two is not so clear.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: But I also want to say a little bit about

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: these two different angles of the result of text field mining.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _In the case of high quality information
column6: we refer to more _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: concise information about the topic.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: Which might be much easier for humans to digest than the raw text data.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _For example
column6: you might face a lot of reviews of a product. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: A more concise form of information would be a very concise summary

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: of the major opinions about the features of the product.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _Positive about
column6: let's say battery life of a laptop. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: Now this kind of results are very useful to help people digest the text data.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: And so this is to minimize a human effort in consuming text data in some sense.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: The other kind of output is actually more knowledge.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: Here we emphasize the utility of the information or

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: knowledge we discover from text data.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _It's actionable knowledge for some decision problem
column6: or some actions to take. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _For example
column6: we might be able to determine which product is more appealing to us

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: or a better choice for a shocking decision.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _Now
column6: such an outcome could be called actionable knowledge

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _because a consumer can take the knowledge and make a decision
column6: and act on it. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _So
column6: in this case text mining supplies knowledge for optimal decision making. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _But again
column6: the two are not so clearly distinguished

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: we don't necessarily have to make a distinction.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _Text mining is also related to text retrieval

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: which is a essential component in many text mining systems.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _Now
column6: text retrieval refers to finding relevant information from _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: a large amount of text data.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: So I've taught another separate book on text retrieval and search engines.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: Where we discussed various techniques for text retrieval.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _If you have taken that book
column6: and you will find some overlap. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: And it will be useful To know the background of text retrieval

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: of understanding some of the topics in text mining.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _But
column6: if you have not taken that book

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _it's also fine because in this book on text mining and analytics
column6: we're _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: going to repeat some of the key concepts that are relevant for text mining.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: But they're at the high level and

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: they also explain the relation between text retrieval and text mining.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: Text retrieval is very useful for text mining in two ways.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _First
column6: text retrieval can be a preprocessor for text mining. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: Meaning that it can help us turn big text data into

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: a relatively small amount of most relevant text data.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: Which is often what's needed for solving a particular problem.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _And in this sense
column6: text retrieval also helps minimize human effort. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: Text retrieval is also needed for knowledge provenance.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: And this roughly corresponds to the interpretation of text

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: mining as turning text data into actionable knowledge.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _Once we find the patterns in text data
column6: or _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _actionable knowledge
column6: we generally would have to verify the knowledge. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: By looking at the original text data.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _So the users would have to have some text retrieval support
column6: go back to the original _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: text data to interpret the pattern or to better understand an analogy or

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: to verify whether a pattern is really reliable.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _So this is a high level introduction to the concept of text mining

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: and the relationship between text mining and retrieval.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _Next
column6: let's talk about text data as a special kind of data. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: Now it's interesting to view text data as data

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: generated by humans as subjective sensors.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _So
column6: this slide shows an analogy between text data and non-text data. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: And between humans as subjective sensors and

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _physical sensors
column6: such as a network sensor or a thermometer. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: So in general a sensor would monitor the real world in some way.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _It would sense some signal from the real world
column6: and _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _then would report the signal as data
column6: in various forms. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _For example
column6: a thermometer would watch the temperature of real world and _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: then we report the temperature being a particular format.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _Similarly
column6: a geo sensor would sense the location and then report. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _The location specification
column6: for _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _example
column6: in the form of longitude value and latitude value. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _A network sends over the monitor network traffic

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: or activities in the network and are reported.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: Some digital format of data.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: Similarly we can think of humans as subjective sensors.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: That will observe the real world and from some perspective.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: And then humans will express what they have observed in the form of text data.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _So
column6: in this sense
column7: human is actually a subjective sensor that would also _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: sense what's happening in the world and

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _then express what's observed in the form of data
column6: in this case

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _Now
column6: looking at the text data in this way has an advantage of being _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: able to integrate all types of data together.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: And that's indeed needed in most data mining problems.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: So here we are looking at the general problem of data mining.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: And in general we would Be dealing with a lot of data

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: about our world that are related to a problem.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: And in general it will be dealing with both non-text data and text data.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: And of course the non-text data are usually produced by physical senses.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: And those non-text data can be also of different formats.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _Numerical data
column6: categorical

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: or multi-media data like video or speech.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _So
column6: these non text data are often very important in some problems. _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _But text data is also very important

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: mostly because they contain a lot of symmetrical content.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _And they often contain knowledge about the users

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: especially preferences and opinions of users.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _So
column6: but by treating text data as the data observed from human sensors

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: we can treat all this data together in the same framework.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _So the data mining problem is basically to turn such data

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: turn all the data in your actionable knowledge to that we can take advantage

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: of it to change the real world of course for better.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: So this means the data mining problem is

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: basically taking a lot of data as input and giving actionable knowledge as output.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _Inside of the data mining module
column6: you can also see _

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: we have a number of different kind of mining algorithms.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _And this is because
column6: for different kinds of data

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: we generally need different algorithms for mining the data.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _For example

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: video data might require computer vision to understand video content.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: And that would facilitate the more effective mining.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: And we also have a lot of general algorithms that are applicable

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _to all kinds of data and those algorithms
column6: of course

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: _Although
column6: for a particular kind of data

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: we generally want to also develop a special algorithm.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: So this course will cover specialized algorithms that

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: are particularly useful for mining text data.

name: 2 - 1 - 1.1 Overview Text Mining and Analytics- Part 1 (00-11-43).srt
text: [MUSIC]
